column4: Hello. Is there anything negative with using x64 instead of x86? Like compatibillity problems?
I've only heard complaints about using flash with it
what happens when you run visudo?
I can see it, but I can't edit it
sorry if this is obvious, but are you running visudo using sudo?
Yes I am
are you able to edit it, or just not save it?
I can edit with "sudo gedit /etc/sudoers" but I can't save it
but when you use visudo, can you edit it and just not save it, or can you not edit at all?
I simply can't edit it (unless you have to do something else than pressing buttons to edit it)
sounds like you're using vi instead of nano.... try doing this first: sudo update-alternatives --set editor /usr/bin/nano
It tells me it can't find the alternative "/usr/bin/nano"
ahh, sorry; try: sudo export EDITOR=nano
sudo: export: command not found
wtf!? something is wrong o_O
Yes, I've noticed. There's always something weird with my Ubuntu :(
what does the output of this command say: echo $SHELL
/bin/bash
how did you install your system? have you made any unusual changes?
I installed it just like it is supposed to be installed 2 days ago. Nothing weird afaik has been changed
well, I think sudoers is the least of your worries if "sudo export EDITOR=nano" tells you export can't be found
What do you recommend?
